sub_topic: Calculation of enthalpy change in a reaction
message_1: Calculate the enthalpy change (∆H) for the combustion of methane (CH4) given that the heat released for the reaction is -890.3 kJ/mol.
message_2:
The enthalpy change (∆H) for the combustion of methane (CH4) is equal to the heat released for the reaction. Since the heat released is -890.3 kJ/mol, the enthalpy change for the combustion of methane is:

∆H = -890.3 kJ/mol
